DOC.brief_summary: Phase 1: An observational study ( registry) will be conducted with the objective of documenting the practice of stroke treatment in brazilian and latin american hospitals. Phase 2: A cluster randomized trial aiming to evaluate the effect of a multifaceted strategy to increase evidence based treatments usage for stroke patients. The hospitals will be randomized into two groups: the multifaceted strategy group and the usual care group.
DOC.brief_title: Brazilian Intervention to Increase Evidence Usage in Practice - Stroke ( BRIDGE-Stroke)
DOC.detailed_description: Study Objective: The purpose of this study is to evaluate a multifaceted strategy to increase evidence based therapies for patients with acute ischemic stroke. Study Population; Patients with suspected stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA) with symptoms lasting up to 24h hours. Quality Improvement Multifaceted Intervention: The strategy includes a simulation based team training, case manager, check lists, reminders and educational material.
DOC.criteria: Patient Eligibility Criteria patients with suspect stroke or TIA lasting for up to 24 hours patients with intracranial hemorrhage, CNS infection , CNS tumor Cluster Eligibility Criteria hospitals with a emergency department, with available tomography, neurologist and alteplase hospitals that don't provide Institutional Authorization Form
